poem:
**Uketsu in Asparagus Dreams**

A mask of rain-hole leaves,  
papier-mache smiles concealed,  
she twists asparagus into fingers,  
weaving whispers, unreal.  
A Cyclopian gaze through digital haze—  
Japanese ink on virtual page.  
In bodysuits of black, she pens her track,  
with voices of a child's age.  
Amongst shadows, her ink breathes.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Am I a Cyclopian monster?’ How masked writer Uketsu went from asparagus videos to literary sensation Hidden behind a white papier-mache mask, wearing a black bodysuit and with a voice modulated to sound something like a little girl’s, is Japan’s latest literary superstar. Almost nothing is known about Uketsu – a made-up name that means “rain hole” – who first gained fame posting surreal videos on YouTube: clips of asparagus that turns into fingers when". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
